meanings.definition: A device or substance used to join two things together to prevent leakage or to keep air, liquid, etc., from entering or escaping.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used seals to stop the oil from leaking out of the engine.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the seals on the envelope to keep the letter secure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought the seals were stickers and tried to peel them off.
meanings.sent4: His trust in her was like a seal that kept their friendship strong.
meanings.sent5: The magical seal on the treasure chest could only be broken by a true hero.

meanings.definition: A design or emblem used as a mark of authenticity or approval.
meanings.sent1: The gold seal on the certificate showed it was genuine.
meanings.sent2: The royal seal on the document indicated it was official.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought the seal was a toy and tried to play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a seal of approval for his hard work.
meanings.sent5: The seal on the product assured customers of its quality.

meanings.definition: A marine mammal with flippers and a streamlined body.
meanings.sent1: The seals basked in the sun on the rocky shore.
meanings.sent2: Children giggled as they watched the seals swim gracefully in the aquarium.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy seal slipped on the ice and flopped around comically.
meanings.sent4: She felt as free as a seal diving into the ocean waves.
meanings.sent5: The seal's sleek body glided effortlessly through the water.
